newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HK's Elec & Eltek to resume trading.
newsitem.headline: HK's Elec & Eltek to resume trading.

text.p: Hong Kong-listed Elec & Eltek International Holding Ltd, which was suspended from trading on Friday, will resume trading on Tuesday, following the announced placement of new shares in its Singapore listed subsidiary.

The parent company Elec & Eltek announced on Saturday the placing of 11 million shares in Elec & Eltek International Company Ltd (E&EI)at US$2.92 per share, a 5.2 percent discount to the subsidiary's closing price of US$3.08 per share on Thursday.
Shares in the Hong Kong parent company and the Singapore listed subsidiary were suspended from trading on Friday.
The placement shares represent 10.68 percent of the issued capital of the company. The US$31 million raised from the new issued is to be used as general working capital.
